intro: Quercus haerens, commonly known as the Haeren oak, is a deciduous tree native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree is characterized by its lobed leaves that turn yellow in autumn and its production of acorns as its fruit. Quercus haerens typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers temperate climates. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
